title: Two-time Pro Bowl WR Thielen retiring from NFL
content: Wide receiver Adam Thielen announced his retirement after 12 seasons in the NFL on social media Wednesday.

title: Jags still plan on Hunter playing both ways in '26
content: Jaguars general manager James Gladstone said Wednesday that the team still plans on Travis Hunter being a two-way player in 2026.

title: LIV signs Dustin Johnson to multiyear extension
content: LIV Golf has signed two-time major champion Dustin Johnson to a multiyear extension, the league announced Wednesday.

title: LeBron separates himself from agent's Reaves take
content: LeBron James cleared the air following the Lakers' 141-116 win over the Hawks on Tuesday, separating himself from the opinion of his agent, Rich Paul of Klutch Sports, who said that L.A. should trade away fan favorite Austin Reaves.

title: Morant on possible Grizzlies exit: 'Live with it'
content: Ja Morant says he has to "live with it" over the possibility of the Grizzlies seeking to trade him. He also told reporters he will "hopefully" play in a pair of games in Europe this week but has already been ruled out for the first contest in Berlin.

title: Hornets to retire Dell Curry's No. 30 jersey
content: Charlotte Hornets great Dell Curry, father of guards Stephen and Seth Curry, is having his jersey retired in March.

title: Amateur stuns Sinner on way to 1 Point Slam win
content: Sydney amateur Jordan Smith beat defending Australian Open champion Jannik Sinner on his way to claiming the $1 million Australian first prize at the Australian Open's 1 Point Slam.

title: Giannis boos fans back as Bucks drubbed at home
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo responded to boos from his home fans in kind, giving two thumbs-down to the crowd following an and-1 layup during Tuesday's blowout loss to the Wolves.

title: The two clear paths the Steelers can take as they figure out life post-Tomlin: Barnwell on what's next
content: Mike Tomlin and the Steelers have parted ways. But will Pittsburgh now change its roster-building approach under the next coach? And who should replace Tomlin?

title: Premier League's top 50 transfers of all time: Who is No. 1?
content: What makes a great signing? Is it trophies won, goals scored, a long run of dominance ... or all of the above? Bill Connelly breaks down the best 50 Premier League moves since it began in 1992-93.

title: Ranking all 32 rookie classes in the NFL: There's the top four ... then everybody else
content: How does every NFL team's rookie group stack up? Aaron Schatz ranked all 32 based on first-year production, starting with surprises up top.

title: Who deserves to make the NBA All-Star team: We made 25 picks
content: Locks? Bubble watch? A bonus 25th player?! We're unveiling our 2026 rosters full of legends, first-timers and a few difficult cuts.

title: A slam for Scheffler? What's next for Rory? Storylines to watch heading into 2026 PGA Tour season
content: What will the biggest names on tour do in 2026? What will Brooks Koepka's return look like? We dive into some of the biggest stories to watch as the season gets started

title: Nine open NFL coaching jobs, nine predicted hires: Who will land in Baltimore, Pittsburgh, New York?
content: Could three coaches who were just fired immediately find new NFL teams? With interviews taking place this week, we projected candidates to fill open jobs.

title: How Seahawks started over at QB with Sam Darnold and got back to the playoffs
content: It's been 10 months since the Seahawks traded Geno Smith and signed Darnold. Now they're back in the playoffs.

title: Why did Man United, Chelsea, Real Madrid all sack their managers? It's about culture
content: Why have three of the biggest soccer teams in the world fired their managers in the span of just 12 days? To clubs like Man United or Real Madrid, it's not about results, but how they fit.

title: Cancelo isn't the center back Flick wanted, but might be the fullback Barça need
content: João Cancelo's return to Barcelona began in confusion, but his loan move could give the team a boost.

title: Updated NBA mock draft: Projecting who lands at Nos. 1 through 30
content: Which new names enter Jeremy Woo's updated 2026 NBA mock draft and who slid into the top 30 picks or out of the first round?

title: Rival leagues, charter flights and T-shirts: 11 moments that led to WNBA labor strife
content: CBA negotiations intensified in recent months, but previous events helped spark the stalemate between the WNBA and WNBPA.

title: Nine teams that need to turn around their seasons -- now
content: From expected Final Four contenders like Kentucky and beyond, these teams have work to do in the final stretch.

title: How Miami offensive coordinator Shannon Dawson emerged from nowhere
content: The architect of the Hurricane offense began his career grinding for a job at Southeastern Louisiana.

title: What would a Russian Olympic hockey team look like in 2026?
content: The Games will be missing one of the sport's top countries. Here's what the group could have looked like had it been competing.

title: Dirk linking up with Wagner brothers leads top Magic-Grizz scenes in Europe
content: The Grizzlies and Magic crossed the Atlantic this week to play regular-season games in Berlin and London.

title: Boxing fights we want to see in 2026: Haney-Garcia 2, Canelo-Benavidez, more
content: A lot of major fights took place in 2025 -- but which megafights do we want to see in the year ahead?

title: Supreme Court takes up transgender athlete cases
content: The Supreme Court got complex arguments and passionate demonstrations as it considered two cases related to transgender athletes.

title: NFL divisional round odds, early bets: Seahawks favored vs. 49ers; Rams over Bears
content: Our early bets for the NFL divisional round, plus spreads, lines, totals and FPI analysis for every game.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City prepare Guehi offer
content: Manchester City are readying an offer for Marc Guéhi, and N'Golo Kanté is close to a return to Europe.

title: BSF, ITBP and NIA get new chiefs
content: Shatrujeet Singh Kapoor for ITBP, Praveen Kumar for BSF and Rakesh Aggarwal for NIA were proposed by the Home Ministry

title: TET results sparks concern among in-service teachers, unions seek exemption
content: Test outcome triggers a debate, with teacher unions arguing that when more than half of the teachers fail to qualify, it clearly indicates that the examination does not reflect classroom teaching competencies

title: Australia classifies Indian students ‘high-risk’, tightens visa scrutiny
content: It improves quality over quantity, say experts; this means requiring detailed financial proof, full traceability of source of funds, a strict ‘Genuine Student’ assessment, which may include interviews, and slower and manual checks of documentation

title: 29 Maharashtra civic bodies go to polls on January 15; Mumbai is big prize
content: More than 3.48 crore voters will cast their votes to choose 2,869 corporators from among 15,908 candidates; Votes will be counted on January 16

title: Uncontested victories in Mumbai local polls valid under the law: Bombay High Court
content: The opposition claimed that mass withdrawals were not ‘voluntary’ and Mahayuti allies used coercion, forcing candidates to withdraw

title: Cong leader booked for threatening and abusing Municipal Commissioner
content: The Congress leader threatened the Municipal Commissioner over a flex and banner to promote Kannada film Cult that was removed for violating norms

title: Nipah-hit Bengal nurses critical; two contacts hospitalised
content: One nurse is in coma and the other is on ventilator support; 120 people who came into contact with them have been directed to isolate themselves; State govt. launches helpline to guide public

title: Meitei, Kuki-Zo insurgent groups warned against violating ground rules, continuing extortion
content: MHA, State officials conduct joint review of insurgent groups; UNLF-P, a Meitei group, asked to return looted weapons to police armouries; Kuki-Zo groups asked to relocate seven camps, enforce ground rules

title: KIIFB model should be modernised to turbocharge State’s infrastructure development, says Thomas Isaac
content: Kerala’s new developmental phase can be meaningfully realised by preparing and implementing an action plan focused on a knowledge economy that builds upon the advances made in education, says former Finance Minister

title: UGC brings out new rules against caste discrimination
content: Higher education institutions may lose recognition if they violate the regulations; UGC brings OBCs under the ambit of new rules after their exclusion in the draft version evoked criticism; commission drops proposal to impose penalty for false complaint

title: Marriage halls seek reduction in GST rates, power charges
content: The Tamil Nadu Marriage Hall Owners Association, South India Marriage Hall Owners Federation, and All Kalyana Mandapam Owners Association have jointly written to the respective State governments and the Centre seeking a significant reduction in GST rates

title: Why Gen Z could influence outcome of next civic elections?
content: Parties are scouting candidates and coming up with strategies to strike a chord with a new generation of voters.

title: Mumbai civic elections: Confusing coalitions, absent accountability concern voters as BMC goes to polls
content: Experts are split over voter turnout and air quality remains forgotten as city votes after nine years

title: Quick commerce players’ pledge to drop 10-minute delivery comes as a thumbs up for Kerala
content: In a notice issued on December 23, Kerala Motor Vehicles department had directed the online delivery app companies in Kerala to follow road safety rules and make it part of their corporate policy

title: Jana Nayagan row: Supreme Court to hear producer’s appeal on January 15
content: The Bench would hear KVN Productions’ challenge against the decision of a two-judge Bench of the High Court to stay a single judge’s order to issue U/A 16+ certificate to the film, hours after it was passed.

title: Police profiling of mosques as crime sites is an attempt to strip Muslims of faith: Mehbooba Mufti
content: Imams, caretakers summoned to police stations, asked to submit extensive personal data, creating fear amomng worshippers, says PDP chief; order for police verification of mosques issued by L-G’s office, says NC

title: Farmers raise concerns over paddy procurement through coop. societies
content: They argue that cooperative societies lack both the expertise to manage large-scale procurement efficiently and the ability to pay farmers within two days of collection

title: Actor rape case survivor’s counsel complains to Kerala HC Chief Justice against judge
content: In the complaint, T.B. Mini says Ernakulam District and Principal Sessions Judge Honey M. Varghese, who pronounced the verdict in the case, made derogatory remarks against her

title: Karnataka Information Commission wants 17 of its newly supplied computers to be replaced
content: One of the important specifications for the computers was to have cameras, which, however, are not in the 17 computers supplied

title: Kerala School Kalolsavam 2026 / Celebrating silent spaces of creativity
content: For many gathered at the venue, participating in competitions such as short story writing, cartooning, or essay writing, moments of effort and emotion often pass unnoticed, far removed from the glitz and applause of on-stage performances. Yet students prepare for these events with equal diligence, even when their achievements rarely draw public acclaim

title: Parasakthi team celebrates Pongal with Prime Minister Modi in New Delhi
content: Actors Sivakarthikeyan, Ravi Mohan and music composer G.V. Prakash Kumar, who are part of the film that themed around the anti-Hindi agitations in Madras in the mid-1960s, attended the event

title: Farmers’ march led by Hanuman Beniwal to Jaipur called off after high-voltage drama
content: Mr. Beniwal, critical of the BJP government in the State, says the dharna at Riyan Badi had sent across a ‘historic message’ to the government to render justice to the people waiting for resolution of their grievances

title: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu stresses NDA government’s commitment to safeguarding and propagating Telugu traditions
content: At the Bhogi celebrations conducted at his ancestral village at Naravaripalle, he highlights the importance of tracing one’s cultural roots

title: Kerala School Kalolsavam 2026: Classical wit meets contemporary pulse as young satirists take centre stage
content: Performances at the school arts festival reaffirms that Kerala’s classical art forms continue to evolve, engage, and entertain — gracefully bridging tradition with the pulse of the present

title: Shiv Sena leader seeks action against police officer for misleading court
content: The demand by religious head Siddalinga Swami comes after a court penalises Somaling Kiradalli for furnishing false information

title: SIT to probe replacement of Sabarimala flagstaff
content: The flagstaff at the Sabarimala temple was replaced in 2017, during the tenure of Prayar Gopalakrishnan as Travancore Devaswom Board president. The decision had then been taken as the old flagstaff had deteriorated significantly due to wear and tear

title: Tamil Nadu | Pongal, jaggery and a vanishing tradition
content: Crop disease and changing manufacturing techniques are threatening the GI-tagged jaggery from Veeramangudi in Thanjavur

title: Ground reality at Brahmapuram far removed from rosy picture painted by previous council: Kochi Mayor
content: The reality is that the reclaimed stretch of land is no longer usable, as it has been permeated by river water due to biomining at a depth of 3.5 feet. To reclaim it again, we will need to fill up that stretch, says Mayor

title: Kollam Vigilance Court denies bail to Unnikrishnan Potti
content: Remand period of K.S. Baiju, S. Sreekumar, Pankaj Bhandari, and Govardhan, other accused in the case, extended till January 28

title: Prime Minister Modi’s wishes on my induction into ‘Kenjutsu’ inspiring, says Pawan Kalyan
content: I will strive even harder to serve Bharat and inspire the younger generation to live with discipline, honour our heritage, and work fearlessly for the nation, says the Deputy Chief Minister

title: No demand for source code, say phone makers
content: Industry body MAIT pointed out that the government mandate was amended to remove the language last June itself

title: NGT notice to U.P., M.P., Rajasthan governments over ‘serious health issues’ due to sewage in drinking water
content: The NGT has issued notices to all three State governments and other agencies to file their affidavits on the matter

title: Brahmapuram becomes new flashpoint in UDF-LDF rivalry
content: Mayor V.K. Minimol accuses the LDF of misleading the public about the real state of affairs at Brahmapuram, the seat of waste management projects

title: Elderly man ‘attempts suicide’ near Naidu’s residence at Naravaripalle
content: He was reportedly upset at not being able to handover a representation to the Chief Minister on some land-related issue

title: Procedural glitches delay construction of new building for city school in Kozhikode
content: Classes are now being conducted in age-old buildings that are in a dilapidated condition. Over 1,500 children are studying in the school

title: Thousands witness Makaravilakku at Sabarimala
content: The entire pilgrimage zone, including the surrounding hills, had been packed with devotees for days, all eagerly awaiting the twilight spectacle. Rooftops of buildings, east-facing hillsides, and grasslands within the Sabarimala forest area were occupied by pilgrims seeking vantage points to witness the event.

title: Meghalaya group seeks PM’s help to uproot illegal settlements
content: The Garoland State Movement Committee said the killing of an indigenous youth by suspected Bangladeshi nationals highlights the grave humanitarian and constitutional crisis for the State’s tribal people

title: Bhogi festive fervour engulfs Chittoor rural side
content: Kuppam, Palamaner, Chittoor, Nagari in Chitoor district, and Madanapalle, Rayachoti, and Piler in neighbouring Annamayya district witnesses the festivities in full swing

title: From Chabahar to Kashmir: Why chaos in Iran hurts India, benefits China & Pakistan
content: India watches Iran's protests with unease, fearing a weakened state would disrupt its strategic environment. Iran serves as India's vital western corridor to Central Asia via Chabahar Port and a crucial counterweight to Pakistan's regional influence. A collapse risks jeopardizing connectivity projects and India's multi-alignment policy.

title: US freezes visas for 75 countries: Iran, Russia, Thailand among affected nations - key details
content: The US State Department is indefinitely suspending visa processing for citizens of 75 countries, including Iran, Russia, and Afghanistan, to reassess screening procedures. This move aims to tighten enforcement of the "public charge" provision, denying entry to applicants deemed likely to rely on public welfare benefits.

title: 'Return home': Pakistan's Rizwan asked to leave BBL after 'retired out' call
content: Mohammad Rizwan's 'retired out' decision in the BBL sparked debate in Pakistan, with some calling it disrespectful. Former cricketer Kamran Akmal acknowledged the situation but stressed the need for modern T20 players to adapt their strike rate to evolving league demands.

title: Zuckerberg hired Wang for $14B, now they're clashing: AI team in chaos; new boss moves in
content: Meta's new structure reveals tension between Mark Zuckerberg and Alexandr Wang, the $14 billion AI recruit. Wang finds Zuckerberg's micromanagement stifling, while staff question his leadership for Meta's AI ambitions. A recent strategy clash highlighted differing priorities, with Wang pushing for cutting-edge AI over immediate product integration.

title: Explained: How Greenland fits into Trump's $175 bn Golden Dome missile shield
content: Recognizing Greenland's pivotal role in national defense, President Trump emphasizes its importance for the 'Golden Dome' missile defense initiative. Its strategic position empowers the tracking and interception of potential missile threats from Russia, while also supporting satellite missions through its advanced infrastructure.

title: Amazon's RTO gets stricter: Managers tracking hours; three types of employees under scanner
content: Amazon is now closely monitoring office attendance, tracking not just presence but also exact hours spent by corporate employees. This escalation in surveillance, revealed by an internal document, flags 'Low-Time Badgers' and 'Zero Badgers' who don't meet in-office expectations. The move follows a strict five-day return-to-office mandate, with similar tracking systems emerging at tech rivals like Samsung and Dell.

title: IND vs NZ: 'Very difficult'— Gill rues lack of wickets in middle overs
content: India captain Shubman Gill admitted that his team failed to seize control in the crucial middle overs during their seven-wicket loss to New Zealand in the second ODI at the Niranjan Shah Stadium in Rajkot on Wednesday. Gill felt that the inability to pick up wickets during that phase made defending the total extremely difficult.

title: Gone too far? What Americans think of US op in Venezuela – a ‘less-active’ role in world
content: A new poll reveals over half of Americans believe President Trump has overstepped with military interventions abroad, particularly concerning the recent Venezuela operation. A majority also disapprove of his overall foreign policy and handling of Venezuela. While some see benefits in the Venezuela action, most Americans desire a less active global role for the US.

title: Middle East on boil: US asks military personnel to depart bases; Iran issues warning
content: United States forces are repositioning from key Middle East bases. Tensions with Iran are rising sharply. This follows a crackdown on protests and threats of US military action. Iran warns of attacks on US bases if America strikes. Some personnel are advised to leave Qatar's Al Udeid Air Base. This is described as a posture change amid regional instability.

title: Nvidia H200 AI Chip ban: Chinese customs told to block imports
content: Chinese customs authorities have reportedly banned Nvidia's high-end H200 artificial intelligence chips. This move escalates the silicon trade war between Washington and Beijing. Domestic tech giants are warned against purchasing these processors. Purchases may be approved under special circumstances like university research. Military use of Nvidia chips is completely banned.

title: Vanessa Bryant reveals what helped her survive losing Kobe and Gianna
content: Kobe Bryant's wife, Vanessa Bryant, has been a strong source of strength and support to the couple's three daughters after the family tragically lost the NBA legend and Gianna Bryant in 2020 on an unfortunate helicopter crash. Since then, Vanessa Bryant has shown immense strength and has always been there for their family even as she managed the NBA legend's legacy that he left behind.

title: Rahul’s ton in vain as Mitchell powers NZ to 7-wicket win; series tied at 1-1
content: Kiwi batter Daryl Mitchell’s unbeaten 131 eclipsed KL Rahul’s 112 as New Zealand beat India by seven wickets in the second ODI at Rajkot, levelling the series 1-1. Chasing 285, the visitors finished at 286/3. Mitchell and Will Young added 162, while New Zealand’s spinners outbowled India’s on a slow pitch.

title: Erika Kirk faces backlash for attending Peach Bowl alone amid parenting debate
content: Erika Kirk faced online criticism after attending the Peach Bowl in Atlanta without her children on January 10, 2025. Social media users questioned her choices following the death of her husband, Charlie Kirk. While many criticized her parenting, others defended her, saying grief is personal. Erika has not responded to the backlash.

title: IShowSpeed net worth timeline: How Darren Watkins Jr built his fortune
content: Darren Watkins Jr, known as IShowSpeed, transformed from a young gamer into a global streaming sensation. His earnings grew steadily from YouTube ads to music, tours, and brand deals.  Starting with minimal income, his net worth surged significantly between 2020 and 2026, reaching an estimated $35-40 million.  He maintains a private personal life.

title: Phil Taylor’s net worth timeline: Darts legend’s earnings and life journey
content: Phil Taylor is an English former professional darts player who has a net worth of $7 million, according to the celebrity net worth. The 63-year-old bowed out from the PDC after being defeated by Rob Cross in the 2018 World Championship final, but is still competing in the senior competitions. He was ranked in the second position according to Givemesport. His £8.5 million in profits.

title: US freezes visa processing: Is India in the list? Check the complete details
content: The US State Department has halted immigrant visa processing for 75 countries, including Somalia, Russia, and Pakistan, effective January 21. This indefinite pause is part of a reassessment of visa processing procedures. The department aims to crack down on applicants as part of this new initiative.

title: NIA leadership change: Rakesh Aggarwal appointed as director general; tenure till Aug 2028
content: Senior IPS officer Rakesh Aggarwal has been officially appointed as the Director General of the National Investigation Agency (NIA).  Previously holding the additional charge, Aggarwal, a 1994-batch officer, will now lead the premier counter-terrorism probe body until his superannuation in August 2028. This appointment solidifies his leadership of the agency's crucial national security mandate.

title: Budget 2026 income tax expectations: Will new income tax regime be made more lucrative?
content: Budget 2026 income tax: Will FM Nirmala Sitharaman announce changes in the new income tax regime, which more taxpayers are increasingly adopting to? Times of India surveys tax experts to find out what the top expectations are:

title: 'I want to resign’, shares employee: Have Indian workplaces normalised burnout?
content: Employees in India's white-collar sector are experiencing burnout, questioning if exhaustion is the cost of ambition. A Reddit post highlights this struggle, with individuals seeking a 'soft life' that includes boundaries and personal time. The 'Right to Disconnect Bill' is now in Parliament, reflecting a growing demand for work-life balance.

title: Relief for Trump? US Supreme Court holds off ruling on tariff policy for another day
content: The Supreme Court delayed a ruling on President Trump's global tariffs, a case testing presidential powers and impacting global trade. Businesses await clarity on potential refunds for import duties. The decision, expected by June, will shape future trade policy and presidential authority.

title: WPL: Lanning becomes first Australian to achieve this record in Indian league
content: Meg Lanning became the third player to cross 1,000 runs in WPL history during WPL 2026, reaching the milestone against Delhi Capitals. With 1,050 runs, she is the tournament’s second-highest run-scorer behind Nat Sciver-Brunt. Formerly Delhi Capitals’ captain, Lanning now leads UP Warriorz. The WPL 2026 runs from January 9 to February 5, with the final in Vadodara.

title: What will US hit if it attacks Iran? Trump gets list of 50 targets - report
content: A prominent advocacy group in Washington delivered critical intelligence to the Trump administration, highlighting 50 significant military installations in Iran. This dossier included key sites like the IRGC's main command center and various regional bases believed to play a role in quelling dissent.

title: Silicon Wars: Nvidia GPUs vs Google TPUs
content: The AI hardware market is undergoing a major transformation. Nvidia's dominance with GPUs is being challenged by specialized chips like Google's TPUs and Groq's LPUs. Companies are now opting for a mix of hardware for training and inference. This shift prioritizes efficiency and speed, moving beyond raw power. The demand for specialized processors is rising as AI services expand.

title: Umar vs UAPA: Why bail remains elusive — Decoding Supreme Court ruling
content: The Supreme Court denied bail to student activists Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam in the 2020 Delhi riots case, citing a "hierarchy of culpability." While five co-accused were granted bail, the court found Khalid and Imam to be "ideological drivers" central to the alleged conspiracy's planning and preparation, distinguishing their roles from mere facilitators.

title: MrBeast net worth timeline: From zero to billions in a decade
content: Jimmy Donaldson, known as MrBeast, transformed from a modest YouTuber in 2016 to a billionaire by 2024. His strategy of reinvesting nearly all earnings into extreme content and launching successful ventures like Feastables and MrBeast Burger fueled this meteoric rise. By 2026, his estimated net worth is projected to reach $2.

title: From assembly-line to punch line: Trump’s middle finger steals the show at Ford plant
content: President Trump's visit to a Ford factory turned contentious when a worker yelled an insult, prompting a defiant gesture from the president. The worker's subsequent suspension sparked a viral online fundraising effort, highlighting the deep political divisions surrounding Trump's confrontational style and its impact on American workers.

title: 'Wrong to support those who criticise our nation': BAI rejects hygiene concerns
content: The Badminton Association of India has refuted claims of poor playing conditions at the India Open 2026, calling it a test event for the upcoming World Championships. BAI's general secretary defended the arrangements, attributing player complaints to individual health issues and politics, while Danish shuttlers cited pollution and unhygienic facilities.

title: Model, anchor or sadhvi? Harsha Richharia takes holy dip in Narmada; slams critics
content: Model-turned-ascetic Harsha Richharia took a holy dip in the Narmada river on Makar Sankranti, expressing her deep connection to Jabalpur and Maa Narmada. She stated pride in her past career as an anchor and actor, emphasizing her current path to spread dharma. Richharia also voiced pain over criticism from within religious circles regarding her public presence.

title: 'Vital for Golden Dome': Trump's new reason for Greenland grab; pushes Nato for compromise
content: US President Trump advocated for the acquisition of Greenland, emphasizing its strategic importance for national security and promoting a new 'Golden Dome' defense initiative. He argued that Nato's involvement is crucial, warning that without US influence, nations like Russia or China could extend their reach.

title: Vanessa Bryant revisits Kobe’s iconic footwork vs Hornets
content: Vanessa Bryant continues to honor her late husband, Kobe Bryant, by sharing cherished memories. Recently, she posted a throwback clip of Kobe's incredible 2008 dunk against the Charlotte Hornets, highlighting his 'Mamba Mentality.'  She also expressed gratitude on behalf of the Mamba & Mambacita Sports Foundation for the support enabling opportunities for young athletes.

title: Not Dhoni or Pant - KL Rahul becomes 1st keeper to achieve this feat
content: Rahul brought up his eighth ODI hundred in the 49th over by hitting Kyle Jamieson’s full toss for a six. He reached the landmark in 87 balls and remained not out on 112, scoring 11 fours and one six.

title: Trump who? At $1.2tn, China's trade surplus hits new high in 2025 - despite US tariffs
content: US-bound shipments did fall sharply after Donald Trump raised duties in 2025. But under Xi Jinping's guidance, Chinese exporters responded with speed and ingenuity. Sales surged instead to Southeast Asia, Africa, Latin America and Europe. In many cases, goods were routed through third countries, blunting the effect of US tariffs altogether.

title: 'Dynamite' diplomacy: Japan's Takaichi, South Korea's Lee Jae Myung in K-pop drum battle— watch
content: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi and South Korean President Lee Jae Myung shared a unique diplomatic moment, drumming to K-pop hits like BTS's 'Dynamite' and 'Golden' from 'K-pop Demon Hunters' in Nara.  The leaders expressed optimism for bilateral ties, with President Myung noting they "shared harmony atop our individual rhythms." The summit aimed to strengthen relations amidst regional tensions.

title: The Mutual Fund Advisor: What really makes a mutual fund ‘Good’? It’s not last year’s return
content: A very aggressive small-cap fund can be a good satellite holding for a long-term, high-risk investor. The same fund is a terrible choice as a core holding for someone whose child’s college fees are 8 years away and who panics whenever the market falls 10 per cent.

title: Did GrokAI generate sexualised images of minors? Here's what Elon Musk said
content: Elon Musk has taken a stand against allegations that Grok, X's AI chatbot, is involved in generating illegal naked images of minors. He emphasized that the bot only responds to user commands within lawful boundaries. Musk also acknowledged the risks posed by malicious prompt hacking and vowed to implement immediate corrections to these vulnerabilities.

title: Father Calls 21-Year-Old Home To "Forgive" Her For Marriage, Then Shoots Her
content: A 21-year-old married woman was allegedly shot dead by her father in a mustard field after she returned to her village, believing she was being called home for reconciliation.

title: Driving On National Highways? You'll Now Get Alerts For Stray Cattle Movement
content: To reduce road accidents caused by stray cattle, the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has launched a pilot project that sends real-time safety alerts to users of National Highways. This initiative is part of Road Safety Month (January 1-31

title: Iran Conducts Gunfire Drills As Trump Threatens Military Action
content: Iran is conducting live gunfire exercises along its Persian Gulf coast and in areas bordering Iraq and Azerbaijan, as Tehran faces mounting pressure from nationwide anti-government protests and the looming threat of US military intervention.

title: Saudi Territory Off-Limits For US Action Against Iran: Riyadh Tells Tehran
content: Saudi Arabia informed Iran it will not allow its airspace or territory to be used to attack it, media reported, as Washington threatens Tehran with possible military strikes.

title: Violence At Voter Roll Hearing In Bengal. BLOs Hold Sit-In Protest, Resign
content: Tension erupted in Murshidabad's Farakka on Wednesday following allegations of harassment of ordinary citizens and Booth Level Officers in the name of the SIR process.

title: FBI Raids Washington Post Journalist For Reporting "Leaked" Information
content: The FBI on Wednesday searched the home of a Washington Post journalist, the attorney general said, adding officials were investigating an alleged leak from the Pentagon to the reporter, who has written about federal job cuts.

title: Tej Pratap Yadav Claims RJD Will "Merge" With His Party
content: Jan Shakti Janata Dal (JJD) leader Tej Pratap Yadav on Wednesday announced that the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) will merge with the JJD.

title: 10,000-Year-Old Civilisation In Odisha? Archaeological Body Begins Dig
content: Is a 10,000-year-old civilisation hidden beneath the soil of Odisha? Investigations are underway at the Bhimmandali mountains in Redakhol, Sambalpur district, where researchers believe they have found imprints of a Stone Age civilisation.

title: Iran Foreign Minister Dials S Jaishankar, Discusses "Evolving Situation"
content: External Affairs Minister (EAM) S Jaishankar received a call from Iranian Foreign Minister Seyed Abbas Araghchi late Wednesday evening as both ministers discussed the "evolving situation" around Iran.

title: 55-Year-Old Arrested For Raping Girl, 13, In Odisha
content: A 55-year-old man has been arrested in Bhadrak district following the alleged rape of a 13-year-old girl. The accused, identified as Bighina Jena of Bhadrak district of Odisha, is reportedly a relative grandfather of the victim.

title: Infosys CEO Denies Employee Was Deported From US, Says He Was Not Allowed In
content: Infosys CEO and Managing Director Salil Parekh denied claims that an Infosys employee was in detention or deported by the US Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

title: Banned Kite String Kills Another Biker, This Time In Telangana
content: Banned Chinese manja claimed the life of a 35-year-old man in Telangana's Sangareddy district on Wednesday.

title: Foreign Secretary Meets Delegation From Communist Party of China
content: India on Wednesday underlined the need to take "positive steps" to create the right environment for improving ties with China as Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri hosted Sun Haiyan, a senior leader of the Communist Party of China (CPC).

title: US To Suspend Visa Processing Of 75 Nations Including Russia, Iran: Report
content: The Trump administration is suspending all visa processing for visitors from 75 countries starting January 21, Fox News reported on Wednesday, citing a memo from the US State Department.

title: Temples To Social Media: Mamata Banerjee-Abhishek's 5 Strategies For Bengal
content: The aggressive approach adopted by the BJP has compelled Mamata Banerjee and her nephew Abhishek Banerjee to revisit their political strategy ahead of Bengal elections.

title: "Literally Zero": Musk Says Unaware Of Grok Creating Minors' Explicit Images
content: Elon Musk said on Wednesday he was not aware of any "naked underage images" generated by xAI's Grok chatbot, as scrutiny of the AI tool intensifies worldwide.

title: Warfare Overtakes Armed Conflict As Top Risk: World Economic Forum Survey
content: Economic confrontation between nations and its consequences topped the World Economic Forum's (WEF) annual risks perception survey released on Wednesday.

title: Gold Hits Lifetime High Of Rs 1,46,500 Per 10 Grams, Silver At Record High
content: Silver prices zoomed by Rs 15,000 to a fresh record of Rs 2,86,000 per kg in the national capital on Wednesday, while gold also climbed to touch a lifetime high of Rs 1,46,500 per 10 grams, tracking strong global trends.

title: Karnataka To Hold Joint Legislative Session To Discuss Repeal Of MGNREGA
content: The Karnataka cabinet on Wednesday decided to convene a joint session of the state legislature from January 22 to 31, with a primary focus on the Centre's decision to repeal MGNREGA.

title: NFL futures: Seahawks remain Super Bowl favorites; Patriots now AFC front-runner
content: The top two teams in the NFC West have the best odds to win the  Super Bowl . The  Seattle Seahawks  are the favorites to win Super Bowl 60, following closely by the division rival  Los Angeles Rams .  The  New England Patriots  and  Buffalo Bills  are now the top two favorites in the AFC. The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the fifth-best odds to win the Super Bowl despite being the top overall seed in the AFC. They, like the Seahawks, had a bye in the first round.  Houston Texans  round out the AFC contenders, with the  Chicago Bears  and  San Francisco 49ers  considered longshots, as they face the favorites in the divisional round. Here are the Super Bowl odds and conference championship odds for every team still in the hunt. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

title: CFP National Title first look: Previewing Miami-Indiana

title: Power Rankings: How the SEC is shaping the national title race
content: the day-to-day challenges of January are key in putting that picture together . the AP-ranked SEC currently has nine teams battling each other for supremacy . they have already met this season in a game that didn't count in the standings .

title: Preseason top 25 and how to watch
content: all college baseball on ESPN, ESPN2, ESPNU, SEC Network, ACC Network, Big 12 Now on ESPN+, ESPN3, ESPN+ and ACCNX is available on the ESPN App . a team from the SEC has been dominating college baseball as of late .

title: Sizing up the NL Central: What each team still needs to do before spring training
content: the difference in offseason activity level in the national league central has been stark . on the other side of the division, the Chicago Cubs and Pittsburgh Pirates have been active in attempting to improve for the 2026 season . we've assigned each team an urgency rating based on how much each still needs to accomplish .

title: Teams winning the MLB offseason so far -- and those that need to make a big move soon
content: pitchers and catchers report to spring training . free agent pool remains flush with talent this winter . despite languid pace of free agency this winter, most inactive teams have time to salvage their winter. the reality, especially for teams playing at a camp, is a lack of talent .

title: 🏈 Transfer portal: Teams that found best fits
content: the transfer portal is now college football's most immediate roster-shaping tool . it's capable of changing a program's trajectory in a single offseason . we ranked the 15 best portal additions based on providing the greatest fit and value .

title: NBA Power Rankings: Suns on the rise, Celtics backslide
content: the 2026 trade deadline is right around the league (Feb. 5, 3 p.m. ET) and teams are hitting the midseason mark . the biggest name to kick off this trade season was Trae Young . ja Morant, star guard for the Memphis Grizzlies , is officially available .

title: Primer for divisional round matchups: How every team could win next weekend
content: the San Francisco 49ers will play at the Seattle Seahawks on Saturday . the new England Patriots will host the Houston Texans on Sunday . we asked our NFL Nation reporters to pick one thing we learned about the teams they cover during the wild-card round .

title: Clips to Thunder, Pels to Hawks and more NBA draft assets to watch at the trade deadline
content: the Grizzlies are entertaining offers to potentially move Ja Morant before the trade deadline . the new york Knicks will get Washington's first-rounder if it falls outside of the top 8 . nearly half of the league's franchises don't control their pick .

title: 'How many tackles can one man break!?' Remembering Tommie Frazier and the greatest run in national title history
content: quarterback Tommie Frazier scores a touchdown in the 1996 cornhuskers' win . he ducked under a defensive end late in the third quarter of the 1995 national championship . nine Gators got a hand on Frazier, but none could bring him down .
